item.title: Private Credit’s Rapid Evolution Is Raising Risks, Moody’s Warns
item.description: Private credit’s fast-changing landscape is introducing new layers of complexity and risk, according to Moody’s Ratings.

item.title: South African Yields Fall to Record Low After S&P Rating Upgrade
item.description: South African benchmark bond yields fell to the lowest on record after S&P Global Ratings raised the country’s credit rating for the first time in nearly two decades.

item.title: Nigeria Inflation Slows to Three-Year Low, Boosts Rate-Cut Bets
item.description: Nigeria’s annual inflation slowed to a more than three-year low in October, strengthening the case for another interest-rate cut when policymakers meet next week.

item.title: A Quiet Wall Street Force Fueled $17 Trillion Alternatives Boom
item.description: A small circle of investment consultants played a central role in the multi-trillion-dollar push into private markets, steering US pension funds toward private equity, real estate and hedge funds, according to a new study.

item.title: Siemens Healthineers Flags Possible Sale of Diagnostics Unit
item.description: Siemens Healthineers AG is studying options for its Diagnostics business that could include a future sale, a few days after former parent Siemens AG said it plans to reduce its majority holding in the maker of MRI scanners.

item.title: Abu Dhabi’s ADIA to Sell Half Its Stake in Qatari Telecom Firm
item.description: Abu Dhabi Investment Authority is looking to sell a 5% stake in Qatari telecommunications company Ooredoo QPSC in a secondary share sale that could raise as much as $572 million.

item.title: Brazil’s Economic Activity Falls as High Rates Weigh on Growth
item.description: Brazil’s economic activity fell slightly more than expected in September, a sign that growth is flagging under double-digit borrowing costs.

item.title: Affordability Foils US Power Sector’s AI Party
item.description: Concerns over high power bills tempered the mood at a major utility conference last week.

item.title: Royal London Snapped Up Gilts in Rout With Eye on BOE Rate Cuts
item.description: Royal London Asset Management bought UK government bonds during Friday’s market selloff, anticipating that tax hikes in this month’s budget will weigh on economic growth and bolster the case for interest-rate cuts.

item.title: Colombia Looks to Sell Eurobonds Again to Fund Buyback Strategy
item.description: Colombia is looking to tap the eurobond market for the second time in as many months, seeking to raise money to fund another debt buyback as officials continue to push to reduce financing costs.

item.title: CD&R to Buy Bubble Wrap Creator Sealed Air for $6.2 Billion
item.description: Clayton Dubilier & Rice agreed to buy Sealed Air Corp. in a deal valuing the packaging company that invented Bubble Wrap at $6.2 billion.

item.title: CoreWeave’s Worst-Ever Week Shows AI Traders Are Getting Picky
item.description: Money is still pouring in from the race to build out artificial intelligence infrastructure, but traders are suddenly getting more selective about who the beneficiaries will be.

item.title: Rivian 赌其电动汽车工程师能衍生出新业务
item.description: 欢迎收看 Tech In Depth，这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，埃德-鲁德洛（Ed Ludlow）将探讨 Rivian 公司如何利用其电动汽车技术创建其他业务。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ed Ludlow looks at bets Rivian is making that its electric car technology can be used to create other businesses.】

item.title: 可负担性如何扰乱特朗普的关税经济论证
item.description: 美国选民感受到物价上涨的刺痛，迫使特朗普在关税问题上倒退【原文：American voters feeling the sting of higher prices forced Trump to backpedal on tariffs】

item.title: 欧洲评估特朗普对经济增长的影响
item.description: 布鲁塞尔官员表示，欧元区正在经受唐纳德-特朗普贸易政策的考验。【原文：The euro area is weathering Donald Trump’s trade policies, according to Brussels officials.】

item.title: Russian Oil Plunges With Top Producers Days Away From Sanctions
item.description: Russia’s flagship oil price plunged to the lowest in over 2 1/2 years last week, with days to go until US sanctions are due to hit the nation’s two largest producers.

item.title: 智利比索飙升，右翼人士以绝对优势进入决胜阶段
item.description: 智利比索在周一开盘时反弹，因为保守派何塞-安东尼奥-卡斯特以绝对优势晋级第二轮投票，击败了共产党人珍妮特-哈拉，尽管国会的分裂可能会使前景变得复杂。【原文：The Chilean peso rallied at market open Monday after arch-conservative José Antonio Kast advanced to the second round of voting as a clear favorite against the communist Jeannette Jara, though a split Congress could complicate the outlook.】

item.title: 就业市场正在升温— 人们通常不愿意从事的工作
item.description:
对于薪酬低、工作条件艰苦的工作，申请人数增加，离职率下降。【原文：

Applications are up and turnover is down for jobs with low pay and tough working conditions.

】

item.title: 美国初创企业 GMI Cloud 将在台湾建造价值 5 亿美元的数据中心
item.description: 美国数据中心运营商 GMI Cloud 计划在台湾新建一座价值 5 亿美元的设施，与 Alphabet 公司旗下的谷歌等大型企业一道，为世界上最先进的芯片制造基地提供云服务。【原文：US data center operator GMI Cloud plans to establish a new $500 million facility in Taiwan, joining bigger players such as Alphabet Inc.’s Google in offering cloud services to the world’s most advanced chipmaking base.】

item.title: 警惕的股票牛市盯上沃尔玛和塔吉特，寻找消费者健康线索
item.description:
政府数据的缺乏提高了盈利报告的风险。【原文：

Lack of government data raises the stakes for earnings reports.

】

item.title: 巴基斯坦限制外币交易使用数字渠道
item.description: 巴基斯坦中央银行已指示外汇交易商只能通过账户间转账为居民存款，以鼓励数字支付。【原文：Pakistan’s central bank has directed foreign exchange dealers to make deposits for resident citizens only through account-to-account transfers, in a move to encourage digital payments.】

item.title: 土耳其斯沃琪工人就薪酬和工作条件发起罢工
item.description: 斯沃琪集团（Swatch Group AG）在土耳其购物中心的店员正在举行罢工，要求提高工资和改善工作条件。该公司表示，他们的要求 "不切实际"。【原文：Swatch Group AG store workers across Turkish shopping malls are on strike seeking better pay and improved conditions. The company said their demands were “unrealistic.”】

item.title: 彼得-蒂尔基金第三季度抛售全部英伟达股份
item.description: 据一份 13F 文件显示，彼得-蒂尔（Peter Thiel）的对冲基金 Thiel Macro LLC 在第三季度抛售了其持有的英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp.【原文：Peter Thiel’s hedge fund Thiel Macro LLC sold off its holdings in Nvidia Corp. during the third quarter, according to a 13F filing.】

item.title: 特朗普公司计划与沙特合作伙伴共同打造马尔代夫代币化度假村
item.description: 特朗普组织正与其沙特阿拉伯合作伙伴计划在马尔代夫建造一个豪华度假村，并计划将该酒店开发项目象征性化。【原文：The Trump Organization is planning a luxury resort in the Maldives with its Saudi Arabian partner and plans to tokenize the hotel development project.】

item.title: 逢低买盘提振华尔街策略师期待年底反弹
item.description: 周五，当交易员们走进办公室时，他们面临着一个选择。是锁定利润，因为 S&P 500 指数期货显示，今天又将是惨烈的抛售日；还是听从华尔街策略师的建议，逢低买入。【原文：As traders rolled into the office Friday, they were greeted with a choice. Lock in profits as futures on the S&P 500 Index were pointing to another brutal day of selling, or heed the advice of Wall Street strategists and buy the dip.】

item.title: 中国政府削减开支幅度为四年多来最大
item.description: 中国 10 月份的财政支出大幅下滑，创下至少 2021 年以来的最大降幅，削弱了投资和经济增长的主要驱动力。【原文：China’s broad fiscal spending slumped in October by the most since at least 2021, crippling a key driver of investment and economic growth.】

item.title: 欧盟称，2025 年后欧元区将实现温和增长
item.description: 据欧盟委员会称，欧元区经济在经受住唐纳德-特朗普的关税动荡后将保持温和扩张，好于预期。【原文：The euro-area economy will maintain its moderate expansion after weathering Donald Trump’s tariff turmoil better than expected, according to the European Commission.】

item.title: 利率下降刺激需求，加拿大房市重拾升势
item.description: 加拿大的房地产市场在 10 月份出现反弹，销量和价格双双上涨，原因是央行的降息措施似乎正在促使购房者放弃观望。【原文：Canada’s housing market bounced back in October, with both sales and prices rising, as the central bank’s rate cuts appear to be nudging buyers off the sidelines.】

item.title: 铝业公司中国宏桥寻求 12 亿美元出售股份
item.description: 铝生产商中国宏桥集团有限公司计划通过出售股票融资 93 亿港元（12 亿美元），以帮助为其项目提供资金并减少债务。【原文：Aluminum maker China Hongqiao Group Ltd. plans to raise HK$9.3 billion ($1.2 billion) from selling shares to help fund its projects and reduce debt.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利的威尔逊是股票大牛股之一，他认为 S&P 将上涨 16
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）策略师迈克尔-威尔逊（Michael Wilson）成为最看好美国股市的人之一，他预测在强劲企业盈利的支撑下，美国 500 指数（S&P 500 Index）明年将上涨 16%。【原文：Morgan Stanley strategist Michael Wilson became one of the most bullish voices on US stocks as he predicted a 16% rally for the S&P 500 Index over the next year underpinned by strong corporate earnings.】
